entries.meaning: The position or office of an augur.
examples: 1865,  Charles Merivale,  History of the Romans Under the Empire‎[1]:...we cannot wonder that the emperor allowed him to enjoy no higher distinction than the formal dignity of the Augurate, in which he carefully makred the degrees of his esteem...

verbs.description: augurate (third-person singular simple present augurates, present participle augurating, simple past and past participle augurated)

entries.meaning: To make or take auguries; to augur; to predict.
examples: There are habits of misapprehension and prejudice common to every class of men; fretfulness, industrious to seek, or even feign, and brood upon matter that may nourish it;  […]  melancholy, augurating always for the worst; besides many more, some of which every man may find lurking in his own breast, if he will but look narrowly into it.
